intro: Hieracium nigrescens subsp. macrostylum, commonly known as the large-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from June to August. It prefers moist, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and riverbanks.
